      • getTriggerForName

        public AbstractTriggerManager.Trigger getTriggerForName(String name)
        The naming follows this rule: triggers saved in the NamedTriggers folder will have name exactly same as the file name. However, if you have another folder under NamedTriggers, and the trigger is saved under that folder, you need to specify the folder in front of the file name. For example, if you have your trigger path NamedTriggers/SomeFolder/AnotherFolder/yourtrigger, then the name will be like this: NamedTriggers:SomeFolder:AnotherFolder:yourtrigger.
        Parameters:
        name - the trigger name including path if any exists
        Returns:
        the Trigger; null if no such trigger

      • load

        protected void load(File file)
             throws AbstractTriggerManager.TriggerInitFailedException,
                    IOException
        Load script file or folder recursively. If given file is file, it will just load the trigger, but if it is folder, it will recursively load the trigger with their path named appended with ':' sign. For example, if Test is under Hi folder, it will be named Hi:Test.
        Parameters:
        file - the file/folder
        Throws:
        IOException
        LexerException
        ParserException
        AbstractTriggerManager.TriggerInitFailedException
